info.title: Specification for corectl
info.description: Corectl contains various commands to interact with the Qlik Associative Engine.

long: Corectl contains various commands to interact with the Qlik Associative Engine. See respective command for more information

traffic.name: traffic
traffic.usage: Log JSON websocket traffic to stdout

build.short: Reloads and saves the app after updating connections, dimensions, measures, objects and the script

app.name: app
app.usage: App name, if no app is specified a session app is used instead.

config.name: config
config.usage: path/to/config.yml where parameters can be set instead of on the command line

connections.name: connections
connections.usage: path/to/connections.yml that contains connections that are used in the reload. Note that when specifying connections in the config file they are specified inline, not as a file reference!

dimensions.name: dimensions
dimensions.usage: A list of generic dimension json paths

headers.name: headers
headers.usage: Headers to use when connecting to qix engine

measures.name: measures
measures.usage: A list of generic measures json paths

objects.name: objects
objects.usage: A list of generic object json paths

script.name: script
script.usage: path/to/reload-script.qvs that contains a qlik reload script. If omitted the last specified reload script for the current app is reloaded

ttl.name: ttl
ttl.usage: Engine session time to live in seconds

catwalk.short: Opens the specified app in catwalk
catwalk.long: Opens the specified app in catwalk. If no app is specified the catwalk hub will be opened.

app.name: app
app.usage: App name, if no app is specified a session app is used instead.

catwalk-url.name: catwalk-url
catwalk-url.usage: Url to an instance of catwalk, if not provided the qlik one will be used.

config.name: config
config.usage: path/to/config.yml where parameters can be set instead of on the command line

eval.short: Evaluates a list of measures and dimensions
eval.long: Evaluates a list of measures and dimensions. To evaluate a measure for a specific dimension use the <measure> by <dimension> notation. If dimensions are omitted then the eval will be evaluated over all dimensions.

app.name: app
app.usage: App name, if no app is specified a session app is used instead.

config.usage: path/to/config.yml where parameters can be set instead of on the command line

headers.name: headers
headers.usage: Headers to use when connecting to qix engine

ttl.name: ttl
ttl.usage: Engine session time to live in seconds

generate-docs.short: Generate markdown docs based on cobra commands
generate-docs.long: Generate markdown docs based on cobra commands

generate-spec.short: Generate API spec based on cobra commands
generate-spec.long: Generate API spec docs based on cobra commands

headers.name: headers
headers.usage: Headers to use when connecting to qix engine

ttl.usage: Engine session time to live in seconds

apps.short: Prints a list of all apps available in the current engine
apps.long: Prints a list of all apps available in the current engine

json.name: json
json.usage: Prints the information in json format

app.usage: App name, if no app is specified a session app is used instead.

connection.short: Shows the properties for a specific connection
connection.long: Shows the properties for a specific connection

connections.long: Prints a list of all connections in the specified app

json.usage: Prints the information in json format

dimension.short: Shows content of an generic dimension
dimension.long: Shows content of an generic dimension. If no subcommand is specified the properties will be shown.

app.name: app
app.usage: App name, if no app is specified a session app is used instead.

layout.short: Evaluates the layout of an generic dimension
layout.long: Evaluates the layout of an generic dimension

properties.short: Prints the properties of the generic dimension
properties.long: Prints the properties of the generic dimension

dimensions.short: Prints a list of all generic dimensions in the current app
dimensions.long: Prints a list of all generic dimensions in the current app

json.usage: Prints the information in json format

field.long: Prints all the values for a specific field in your data model

app.name: app
app.usage: App name, if no app is specified a session app is used instead.

fields.long: Prints all the fields in an app, and for each field also some sample content, tags and and number of values

app.name: app
app.usage: App name, if no app is specified a session app is used instead.

keys.long: Prints a fields list containing key-only fields

app.name: app
app.usage: App name, if no app is specified a session app is used instead.

measure.short: Shows content of an generic measure
measure.long: Shows content of an generic measure. If no subcommand is specified the properties will be shown.

app.name: app
app.usage: App name, if no app is specified a session app is used instead.

layout.short: Evaluates the layout of an generic measure
layout.long: Evaluates the layout of an generic measure and prints in JSON format

properties.short: Prints the properties of the generic measure
properties.long: Prints the properties of the generic measure in JSON format

measures.short: Prints a list of all generic measures in the current app
measures.long: Prints a list of all generic measures in the current app in either plain text or json

app.name: app
app.usage: App name, if no app is specified a session app is used instead.

json.name: json
json.usage: Prints the information in json format

meta.long: Lists tables, fields, associations along with metadata like memory consumption, field cardinality etc

app.usage: App name, if no app is specified a session app is used instead.

object.short: Shows content of an generic object
object.long: Shows content of an generic object. If no subcommand is specified the properties will be shown.

app.name: app
app.usage: App name, if no app is specified a session app is used instead.

data.short: Evaluates the hypercube data of an generic object
data.long: Evaluates the hypercube data of an generic object

layout.short: Evaluates the hypercube layout of an generic object
layout.long: Evaluates the hypercube layout of an generic object in JSON format

properties.short: Prints the properties of the generic object
properties.long: Prints the properties of the generic object in JSON format

objects.short: Prints a list of all generic objects in the current app
objects.long: Prints a list of all generic objects in the current app in either plain text or JSON format

app.usage: App name, if no app is specified a session app is used instead.

json.name: json
json.usage: Prints the information in json format

script.long: Fetches the script currently set in the app and prints it in plain text.

app.name: app
app.usage: App name, if no app is specified a session app is used instead.

status.short: Prints status info about the connection to engine and current app
status.long: Prints status info about the connection to engine and current app, and also the status of the data model

app.name: app
app.usage: App name, if no app is specified a session app is used instead.

tables.long: Prints tables summary for the data model in an app

app.name: app
app.usage: App name, if no app is specified a session app is used instead.

help.long:
Help provides help for any command in the application.
Simply type corectl help [path to command] for full details.

connections.short: Sets or updates the connections in the current app
connections.long: Sets or updates the connections in the current app

connections.name: connections
connections.usage: path/to/connections.yml that contains connections that are used in the reload. Note that when specifying connections in the config file they are specified inline, not as a file reference!

dimensions.short: Sets or updates the dimensions in the current app
dimensions.long: Sets or updates the dimensions in the current app

measures.short: Sets or updates the measures in the current app
measures.long: Sets or updates the measures in the current app

objects.short: Sets or updates the objects in the current app
objects.long:
Sets or updates the objects in the current app.
The JSON objects can be in either the GenericObjectProperties format or the GenericObjectEntry format

script.short: Sets the script in the current app
script.long: Sets the script in the current app
